title.narrative: COMMUNICATIONS, ADVOCACY & PARTNERSHIPS

description.narrative: Actions related to management of partnerships and public advocacy, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programmes are eficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Actions related to management of partnerships and public advocacy

description.narrative: UNICEF influenced school reopening, positioned mental health into public agenda, and supported;progress in vaccination, highlighting the;effects of the COVID-19 crisis among;children;and adolescent, through effective communication and advocacy, using traditional;and digital;media,;outdoors communication, influencers, and;written press (through;statements;in favor of gradual school reopening).;;UNICEF expanded its reach at the national level and in targeted sub-national regions with 1,126 media mentions, 7,3 million TV, print, radio, and digital ad ads (882 per cent above goal), and 353 million in social media reach. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/12/2021
